parts.text: {"word":"elevate","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(物理的に)持ち上げる、高くする、昇降させる","english_definition":"to raise something to a higher position or level.","examples":[{"sentence":"The platform elevated the speaker so everyone could see him.","translation":"演台は講演者を高くしたので、誰もが見ることができた。"},{"sentence":"They elevated the bridge to allow the ship to pass.","translation":"彼らは船が通過できるように橋を上げた。"},{"sentence":"Elevate your feet to reduce swelling.","translation":"腫れを軽減するために足を高くしてください。"}],"collocations":["elevate something to a higher position","elevate the spirits","elevate the mood"],"synonyms":["raise","lift","hoist","uplift"],"antonyms":["lower","drop","descend"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(地位・身分・重要性などを)高める、昇進させる、向上させる","english_definition":"":"to raise someone to a higher rank or social position; to improve something.","examples":[{"sentence":"He was elevated to the position of CEO.","translation":"彼はCEOの地位に昇進した。"},{"sentence":"This experience elevated her understanding of the world.","translation":"この経験は彼女の世界に対する理解を高めた。"},{"sentence":"The new policies aim to elevate the standard of living.","translation":"新しい政策は生活水準の向上を目指している。"}],"collocations":["elevate someone to a higher rank","elevate standards","elevate the level of something","elevate the importance of something"],"synonyms":["promote","upgrade","advance","enhance","improve"],"antonyms":["demote","degrade","lower","reduce"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(気分・感情などを)高揚させる、盛り上げる","english_definition":"to improve someone's mood or feelings.","examples":[{"sentence":"The music elevated our spirits.","translation":"その音楽は私たちの気分を高揚させた。"},{"sentence":"The good news elevated her mood.","translation":"良い知らせは彼女の気分を盛り上げた。"}],"collocations":["elevate the spirits","elevate the mood"],"synonyms":["uplift","exalt","inspire","cheer"],"antonyms":["depress","discourage","sadden"]}],"etymology":{"value":"ラテン語の\"elevare\"（持ち上げる、軽くする）から派生。\"e-\"（外へ、上へ）+ \"levare\"（持ち上げる）から構成される。\"Levare\"は\"levis\"（軽い）に関連する。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈelɪveɪt/","syllables":"el-e-vate"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["elevate","elevates"],"past_simple":"elevated","past_participle":"elevated","present_participle":"elevating"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"\"Elevate\"は、物理的な意味での「持ち上げる」だけでなく、抽象的な意味での「高める」「向上させる」という意味合いも持ちます。人の地位や気分、物事の質などを高める場合に使われます。","priority":"★★☆"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ He elevated his salary.","correct":"✓ He elevated his position. / ✓ He received a salary increase.","note":"給料を「高める」というよりは、地位が「高まる」という文脈で使われることが多いです。給料が上がった場合は\"salary increase\"を使うのが適切です。"},{"incorrect":"✗ Elevate the temperature.","correct":"✓ Raise the temperature.","note":"温度を上げる場合は、より一般的な\"raise\"を使う方が自然です。\"Elevate\"は、抽象的な意味合いで「高める」場合や、特別な目的で物理的に「持ち上げる」場合に使われます。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["elevation (名詞: 高さ、標高、昇進)","elevator (名詞: エレベーター)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"中頻度","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"\"Elevate\"は、何かを物理的に高くしたり、比喩的に質や地位を向上させたりすることを意味する動詞です。例えば、演台がスピーチをする人を「elevate（高くする）」ことで見やすくしたり、昇進によって地位が「elevate（高められる）」といった使い方をします。日常会話よりは、ややフォーマルな場面や書き言葉で使われることが多い単語です。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The museum is planning to elevate the statue onto a higher pedestal.","translation":"美術館は像をより高い台座に上げる計画を立てている。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"持ち上げる"},{"sentence":"The company's goal is to elevate customer satisfaction.","translation":"会社の目標は顧客満足度を高めることだ。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"高める"},{"sentence":"Listening to classical music can elevate your mood.","translation":"クラシック音楽を聴くことは気分を高揚させることができる。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"高揚させる"},{"sentence":"The senator was elevated to the position of Secretary of State.","translation":"その上院議員は国務長官の地位に昇進した。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"昇進させる"}]}
